member.name: T:VSLangProj.BuildManager
member.summary: Used by third-party developers to manage the portable executable (PE) files produced by running custom tools.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.BuildManager.BuildDesignTimeOutput(System.String)
member.summary: Builds a temporary portable executable (PE) and returns its description in an XML string.
member.returns: The XML description of the portable executable follows this format, shown for a custom tool output file named DataSchema.cs: Copy Code<root> <Application private_binpath = "AbsoluteTemporaryOutputPath"/> <Assembly codebase = "DataSchema.cs.dll" name = "DataSchema.cs" version = "0.0.0.0" snapshot_id = "0" replaceable = "True" /> </root>The attributes are described below.AttributeDescriptionprivate_binpathThe full path of the directory that contains the temporary PE. This path is combined with the attribute to create the full path to the temporary PE assembly.codebaseThe path and file name of the temporary PE relative to the .nameThe .NET Framework simple name of the assembly being generated. versionThe major, minor, build, and revision version numbers. The value is always "0.0.0.0".snapshot_idAn integer that is incremented each time the PE is recompiled.replaceableIndicates whether the project system can replace the assembly, and whether a designer should not hold a write lock on the file. Is always set to true.
member.param: Required. Moniker string for the temporary PE to build. The moniker string must be one of the strings returned by the property.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.BuildManager.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets the project of which the selected item is a part. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.BuildManager.DesignTimeOutputMonikers
member.summary: Gets the temporary portable executable (PE) monikers for a project.
member.returns: The returned object is an array of strings, where each string in the array is a temporary PE moniker.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.BuildManager.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.BuildManager.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of a given object.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.FileProperties
member.summary: Represents the various properties of the specified project file, such as its name, size, the date it was created and last modified, and so forth. This type provides internal-only access to file properties. For more information, see Accessing Project Type Specific Project, Project Item, and Configuration Properties.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.Imports
member.summary: Contains the collection of all project imports for a Visual Basic project. The specified imports statements are passed directly to the compiler and apply to all the files in the project.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.Imports.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new import statement to the collection.
member.param: Required. The import statement string. The format of an import string is:[alias = ]namespace[.*]Items enclosed in square brackets are optional.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Imports.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets the project that contains the selected item. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Imports.Count
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of objects in the collection. Read-only.
member.returns: The number of objects in the collection.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Imports.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.Imports.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumeration for items in a collection.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.Imports.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an indexed member of the object. The Item method is the default method for the object.
member.returns: Returns an imports statement string by its position in the collection.
member.param: Required. A one-based index into object.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Imports.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of a given object.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.Imports.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes an imports statement from the collection. The imports statement to be removed may be indexed by either the string specifying the import or by a one-based index.
member.param: Required. Either a one-based index into the collection, or the imports statement string to remove.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.ImportsEvents
member.summary: Provides access to events that are raised when a project Imports statement is added to or deleted from a Visual Basic project. Use this object for functionality and refer to for this object’s documentation.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.ImportsEventsClass
member.summary: Refer to for this functionality. Do not instantiate from this class.

member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.summary: Occurs immediately after an Imports statement has been added to a Visual Basic project.

member.summary: Occurs immediately after an Imports statement is removed from a Visual Basic project.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.PrjBrowseObjectCATID
member.summary: The enumeration is used for extension of the properties that appear in the Properties window for projects and project items. Extension is typically used by ISVs to extend the automation interface. Developers may add or delete items from the Properties window, by using the appropriate Category ID (CATID) to extend the automation interface. For more information, see Spectrum of Visual Studio Automation.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjBuildAction
member.summary: Specifies a value indicating the type of build action for the current project item.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjBuildAction.prjBuildActionNone
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjBuildAction.prjBuildActionCompile
member.summary: The file is compiled.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjBuildAction.prjBuildActionContent
member.summary: The file is included in the Content project output group (see Deploying Applications and Components)

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjBuildAction.prjBuildActionEmbeddedResource
member.summary: The file is included in the main generated assembly or in a satellite assembly as a resource.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.PrjCATID
member.summary: Used for automation extension of the object.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.PrjCATID.prjCATIDProject
member.summary: Project automation object CATID.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.PrjCATID.prjCATIDProjectItem
member.summary: ProjectItem automation object CATID.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjCompare
member.summary: Specifies the default string comparison method for a project.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjCompare.prjCompareBinary
member.summary: Comparison based on internal binary representations.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjCompare.prjCompareText
member.summary: Comparison based on case-insensitive text order determined by locale.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjCopyProjectOption
member.summary: This enumeration is used by the to determine which project files are copied when the project is copied.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjCopyProjectOption.prjRunFiles
member.summary: Copy only the files needed to run the application.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjCopyProjectOption.prjProjectFiles
member.summary: Copy all the project files.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjCopyProjectOption.prjAllFiles
member.summary: Copy all the files in the source project folder.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjExecCommand
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjHTMLPageLayout
member.summary: Used by the of the Project.Properties collection object. The specifies the default layout for new HTML pages.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjHTMLPageLayout.prjHTMLPageLayoutFlow
member.summary: HTML elements are arranged according to the order that they occur in the HTML markup.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjHTMLPageLayout.prjHTMLPageLayoutGrid
member.summary: HTML elements are positioned using x and y coordinates.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.PrjKind
member.summary: Indicates the type of the Project object.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.PrjKind.prjKindCSharpProject
member.summary: Visual C# Projects/Project automation object kind.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.PrjKind.prjKindVBProject
member.summary: Visual Basic Projects/Project automation object kind.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.PrjKind.prjKindVSAProject
member.summary: Macro Projects/Project automation object kind.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjOptionExplicit
member.summary: Used by the property.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOptionExplicit.prjOptionExplicitOff
member.summary: Variables do not need to be declared before use.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOptionExplicit.prjOptionExplicitOn
member.summary: Variables must be declared before use.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjOptionStrict
member.summary: Used by the property.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOptionStrict.prjOptionStrictOff
member.summary: Implicit conversions are allowed.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOptionStrict.prjOptionStrictOn
member.summary: Implicit narrowing conversions are prohibited.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjOriginatorKeyMode
member.summary: Used by the . If the project has an originator key, it may be supplied through a key file or a key container.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOriginatorKeyMode.prjOriginatorKeyModeNone
member.summary: Assembly has no key.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOriginatorKeyMode.prjOriginatorKeyModeFile
member.summary: Key is in a file.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOriginatorKeyMode.prjOriginatorKeyModeContainer
member.summary: Key is in a container.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjOutputType
member.summary: Used by the . Three output types are supported: Windows application, console application, and class library.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOutputType.prjOutputTypeWinExe
member.summary: Windows application.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOutputType.prjOutputTypeExe
member.summary: Console application.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjOutputType.prjOutputTypeLibrary
member.summary: Class library.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjProjectType
member.summary: Used by the . This enumeration lists the two types of projects, local and Web.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjProjectType.prjProjectTypeLocal
member.summary: Local project.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjReferenceType

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjReferenceType.prjReferenceTypeAssembly
member.summary: a .NET Framework Assembly.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjReferenceType.prjReferenceTypeActiveX

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjScriptLanguage
member.summary: Used by the . Two script languages are supported, ECMAScript (JScript, JavaScript) and VBScript.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjScriptLanguage.prjScriptLanguageJScript
member.summary: ECMAScript (JScript, JavaScript)

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjScriptLanguage.prjScriptLanguageVBScript
member.summary: VBScript

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjStartAction
member.summary: Used by the StartAction property to indicate the start action of a project for debugging.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjStartAction.prjStartActionProject
member.summary: Indicates that the executable file (for Windows Application and Console Application projects) or the Start Page (for Web projects) should be started when the application is debugged. Class library projects cannot be started directly.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjStartAction.prjStartActionProgram
member.summary: Indicates that a specific program should be started when the application is debugged.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjStartAction.prjStartActionURL
member.summary: Indicates that a particular URL should be accessed when the application is debugged.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjStartAction.prjStartActionNone
member.summary: Indicates that no project, program, or URL should be started when the application is debugged.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjTargetSchema
member.summary: Used by the to define the HTML platform the application needs to be compatible with.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjTargetSchema.prjTargetSchemaIE32Nav30
member.summary: Internet Explorer 3.2 and Navigator 3.0.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjTargetSchema.prjTargetSchemaIE50
member.summary: Internet Explorer 4.0 and higher.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjTargetSchema.prjTargetSchemaNav40
member.summary: Netscape Navigator 4.0.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel
member.summary: Used by the WarningLevel property to indicate the types of warnings displayed during compilation.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel.prjWarningLevel0
member.summary: Turns off emission of all warning messages.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel.prjWarningLevel1
member.summary: Displays severe warning messages.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel.prjWarningLevel2
member.summary: C# only. Displays level 1 warnings plus certain less-severe warnings, such as warnings about hiding class members.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel.prjWarningLevel3
member.summary: C# only. Displays level 2 warnings plus certain less-severe warnings, such as warnings about expressions that always evaluate to true or false.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWarningLevel.prjWarningLevel4
member.summary: C# only. Displays all level 3 warnings plus informational warnings. This is the default warning level at the command line.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.prjWebAccessMethod
member.summary: Used by the .

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWebAccessMethod.prjWebAccessMethodFileShare
member.summary: Use the Windows file system.

member.name: F:VSLangProj.prjWebAccessMethod.prjWebAccessMethodFrontPage
member.summary: Use FrontPage Server Extensions.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.Reference
member.summary: Represents one reference in the project. Including a reference in a project allows you to use any of the public members contained in the reference. Projects may include references to other .NET projects, .NET assemblies, and COM objects.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.BuildNumber
member.summary: Gets the build number of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: Long. The value returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyBuild number of the reference; 0-9999.COM0

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Collection
member.summary: Gets the collection containing the object supporting this property or contained within this code construct.
member.returns: Returns a collection relating to the object. See Remarks for more information.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets the project that the selected item is a part of. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.CopyLocal
member.summary: Determines whether the reference is copied to the local bin path.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Culture
member.summary: Gets the culture string of a reference. Read-only.
member.returns: The return value depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyCulture string. For example, "EN-US" for English - United States.COMLocale ID. The string is the hex locale ID of the type library being reference. For example, "0" for multilanguage or "409" for English - United States.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Description
member.summary: Gets a text description of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: For a object, the return value depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyAssembly description.COMType library description.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Extender(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the requested Extender object if it is available for this object.
member.returns: This property returns Nothing or null is no Extender object is available.
member.param: Required. The name of the Extender to return.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.ExtenderCATID
member.summary: Gets the Extender category ID (CATID) for the object.
member.returns: Returns the GUID representing the CATID of the object as a string.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.ExtenderNames
member.summary: Gets a list of available Extenders for the object.
member.returns: An object containing an automation-compliant array of strings.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Identity
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: The string returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyAssembly name (assembly name without path or extension)COMThe format is:"GUID\major.minor\localeid\wrappertool"For example,"{00000205-0000-0010-8000-00AA006D2EA4}\2.5\409\tlbimp"is returned for ActiveX Data Objects 2.5.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.MajorVersion
member.summary: Gets the major version number of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: Long. The number returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyMajor release number of the reference; 0–9999.COMA long value.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.MinorVersion
member.summary: Gets the minor version number of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: Long. The number returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyMinor release number of the reference; 0–9999. COMA long value.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the object. Read-only.
member.returns: String.The string returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyThe assembly name, which is the file name of the reference without the extension.COMThe name of the wrapper for the referenced type library, which is the file name without the extension.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Path
member.summary: Gets the path to the reference file. Read-only.
member.returns: String. This property returns the path and file name of the reference, if it can be resolved. If the path cannot be resolved, then a blank string is returned. For information on resolving references, see .

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: Gets the public key token for the referenced assembly.
member.returns: A string representing the public key token for the referenced assembly.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.Reference.Remove
member.summary: Gets the reference from the object that contains it.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.RevisionNumber
member.summary: Gets the revision number of the reference. Read-only.
member.returns: Long. The number returned depends on the reference type.Reference TypeValue ReturnedAssemblyRevision version number of the reference; 0–9999.COM0

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.SourceProject
member.summary: Gets a Project object if the reference is a project. Otherwise, it returns Nothing (a null reference). Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.StrongName
member.summary: Gets whether the reference is signed with a public/private key pair. Read-only.
member.returns: true if the reference is signed with a public/private key pair.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Type
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the reference is an assembly or a COM component. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.Reference.Version
member.summary: Gets the version of the selected reference.
member.returns: A string representing the version of the selected reference.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.References
member.summary: Contains all the references to external components in a Visual Basic or C# project.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new reference to the project.
member.param: Required. The path of a COM or .NET Framework reference. This parameter may take three forms:A simple .NET Framework object name, such as "System". A .NET Framework file name (.tlb, .dll, or .ocx file).A COM library file (.tlb, .dll, .ocx, or .exe file). For COM objects, the path needs to include a full path and file name, such as, "D:\SomeApplication\SomeApp.dll". See restrictions in the "COM References" section below on adding COM .exe file references.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.AddActiveX(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a reference to an ActiveX type library.
member.returns: Returns a object for the requested ActiveX library object.
member.param: Required. The type library's globally unique identifier (GUID), expressed as a string.
Optional. The major version number. If omitted, 0 is used.
Optional. The minor version number. If omitted, 0 is used.
Optional locale id. For more information, see .

The wrapper tool to be used when generating an assembly wrapper for the type library. The supported values are described in the following table. [1|1] Value[1|2] Result[2|1] "tlbimp"[2|2] The project system generates a generic wrapper suitable for accessing the COM object's methods and properties.[3|1] "aximp"[3|2] The project system generates a wrapper that Windows forms uses for ActiveX hosting. [4|1] "" (empty string)[4|2] The project system checks if a primary interoperability assembly for the specified type library exists. If found, then that assembly is used as the wrapper for the COM object's methods and properties. If not found, the behavior is the same as if "tlbimp" were specified.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.AddProject(EnvDTE.Project)
member.summary: Adds a new project reference to the project and returns the newly created object.
member.param: Required. The Project object to be added.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.References.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets the project of which the selected item is a part. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.References.Count
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of objects in the collection. Read-only.
member.returns: The number of objects in the collection.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.References.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.Find(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the references in a project for an object that has the specified .
member.param: Required. The of the object.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumeration for items in a collection.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.References.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns an indexed object.
member.param: Required. Either the string of the object or a one-based index into the collection.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.References.Parent
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent object of a given object.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.ReferencesEvents
member.summary: Provides access to events that are raised by adding, deleting, or changing project references. Use this object for functionality and refer to for this object’s documentation.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass
member.summary: Refer to for this functionality. Do not instantiate from this class.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.#ctor
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.add_ReferenceAdded(VSLangProj._dispReferencesEvents_ReferenceAddedEventHandler)
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.add_ReferenceChanged(VSLangProj._dispReferencesEvents_ReferenceChangedEventHandler)
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.add_ReferenceRemoved(VSLangProj._dispReferencesEvents_ReferenceRemovedEventHandler)
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: E:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.ReferenceAdded
member.summary: Occurs immediately after a reference is added to a project.

member.name: E:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.ReferenceChanged
member.summary: Occurs immediately after a reference is modified in a project.

member.name: E:VSLangProj.ReferencesEventsClass.ReferenceRemoved
member.summary: Occurs immediately after a reference is removed from a project.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.VSProject
member.summary: Contains the information specific to a Visual Basic or C# project. It is returned by the object when the project is a Visual Basic or Visual C# project.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.AddWebReference(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a reference to a Web Service to the project. A new Web Service reference subfolder is added to the Web References folder of the project. This new folder contains several other project items related to the Web Service. The method returns the object associated with the new Web Service folder.
member.returns: Returns a object that is the new Web Reference folder.
member.param: Required. Typically, this is a file name URL with a .disco or .vsdisco extension.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.BuildManager
member.summary: Gets the BuildManager object of the . Read-only.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.CopyProject(System.String,System.String,VSLangProj.prjCopyProjectOption,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copies some or all of a Web project to a new location.
member.param: Required. The destination folder for the new project. The folder is created if it does not exist. This string takes the form "http://ServerName/CopyName/".
Required. The UNC path for file-sharing if the project to be copied is using file-share access. Use the empty string if the project is using FrontPage Server Extensions access.
Required. A value that determines which project files are copied — all the files, all the project files, or only the files needed to run the application.
Required. The user's network login ID.
Required. The user's password.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.CreateWebReferencesFolder
member.summary: Creates the Web References folder for the project.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.DTE
member.summary: Gets the top-level extensibility object.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.Events
member.summary: Gets a object that allows you to respond to events of the , , and objects.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.Exec(VSLangProj.prjExecCommand,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary: Microsoft Internal Use Only.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.GenerateKeyPairFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a public/private key file used to form a strong name for the assembly.
member.param: This name of the file to be generated.
If true, only the public key is generated.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.GetUniqueFilename(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a unique file name within the project. Used for naming new project items.
member.returns: A file name that is unique in the project or project folder. If the first parameter is a instance, then the name generated will be unique within the root project folder. The file name will take the form Root?.Extension, where ? is one or more numerals (1, 2, 3, and so on).
member.param: The name generated will have this value as the extension.
A object or a folder object. The file name generated will be unique within this context.
The name generated will start with this string.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.Imports
member.summary: Gets the object associated with the project. For C# projects, the Imports property is set to Nothing (a null reference). Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.Project
member.summary: Gets the generic object associated with the Visual Basic or Visual C# project. Read-only.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.References
member.summary: Gets the collection for the project. Read-only.
member.returns: A collection containing objects, each one representing a reference.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProject.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the appearance of the project in Solution Explorer, refreshes the references, and gets the latest compiled versions of the files.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.TemplatePath
member.summary: Gets the full path of the directory that contains the project-item templates for Visual Basic or C#. Read-only.
member.returns: Returns a string value representing the template path.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.WebReferencesFolder
member.summary: Gets the object representing the Web References folder of the project. If the folder does not exist, this property returns Nothing (a null reference). Read-only.
member.returns: Returns a object representing the Web References folder.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.VSProject.WorkOffline
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a Web project is working online or offline. When it is working offline, development continues on an offline store of project files, so that the project files on the server are not changed.
member.returns: For Web applications, this property returns true if working offline and false if working online. For local projects, this property returns false.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.VSProjectItem.RunCustomTool
member.summary: Runs the custom tool associated with a ProjectItem object. A custom tool is a registered component that implements the IVsSingleFileGenerator interface. Custom tools are similar to designers and editors.

member.name: T:VSLangProj.WebSettings
member.summary: Represents the settings for Web projects.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.WebSettings.AuthoringAccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the Web access method for new projects.

member.name: P:VSLangProj.WebSettings.RepairLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the link repair feature of FrontPage Server Extensions is enabled by default for new projects. Link repair fixes links to pages within the project if they change during project development.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether the link repair feature is enabled for new projects.

member.name: M:VSLangProj.WebSettings.SetDefaultWebProjectCacheDirectory
member.summary: Resets the Web Project Cache Directory to the default

member.name: P:VSLangProj.WebSettings.WebProjectCacheDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the offline location of project files.
member.returns: A string specifying the default Web cache directory.
